Direct Read News Access:  
  • User start page - This web page is used for the "Find Group" command in Direct Read News. This web page can function as a start screen for users also, or the search form can be added on other areas of your site. 
  • User Help Pages - This web page is linked through the "DRN Help" option on the Direct Read News toolbars. These pages describe the different toolbars, options, and the appearance of Direct Read News for end-users.

Direct Read News Administration:

  • System Settings -  For remote access, these settings would already be configured if you used the automated install. This link can provide remote access for updating your web server, news servers and other related system settings. You would need to setup the appropriate permissions in your web server configuration to access through your web browser. Its directory /drn-setup/ can be setup similar to the /drn-admin/ in your web configuration, if you elect to do that.  

  • Global Properties - Adding or changing the settings for email domain, organization, page length, attachment parameters, and default sort. These would be applied as a global default for all users.

Finding a Newsgroup:

A search can be done for a specific newsgroup name on your news server. If the newsgroup name is found, Direct Read News will open to the article list for that newsgroup. The Newsgroup Search engine will also accept a variety of special characters, which can aid you in finding a broad or specific collection of newsgroups. These characters will include:

  • "*" - The asterisk symbol is a wild card search character. As an example, *.sports.* would find newsgroups that have the word sports in their newsgroup title, sports.* would find all groups that start with the word sports, and *.sports would find all groups that end with the word sports.

  • "|" - The pipe symbol is used to join multiple searches. As an example sports.*|*.sports would list all groups that started with the word sports or ended with the word sports. It could also be used to search related newsgroups that might appear in different Usenet hierarchies, such as alt.sports.*|rec.sports.* which would find all newsgroups in the "alt" (Alternative) or "rec" (Recreation) hierarchies that utilized the word sports in their group titles.

  • "&" - The ampersand symbol is a limiting character, meaning a search will only yield groups with one word beyond the "&" symbol. As an example, comp.& would retrieve a newsgroup title like "comp.ai" which only had two words in its title, while a group like "comp.ai.alife" would not be retrieved in this example because the title contains more than two total words.

  • "^" - This symbol is another limiting character, meaning the search will only detect newsgroup titles with no other characters to the left of the "^" symbol. As an example ^rec would pick up all newsgroups starting with the word "rec", but would ignore a newsgroup like "alt.recreation" because it does not begin with the word "rec" in this example.
